title: Walmart | Senior Software Engineer (IN4) | Bangalore
content:
Education: B. Tech (NIT)
Years of Experience: 6
Prior Experience: Investment Bank (MNC)
Current salary: 15 LPA (fixed, I know it's very low; I didn't switch even once in 6 years because of my entrepreneurship :) )
Date of the Offer: 6th July 2022
Company: Walmart
Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer (IN4)
Location: Bangalore, India
Salary: 28 LPA (Base) + 1.34L (PF)
Stock bonus: 7 LPA (25% of base salary vested over a four years)
Bonus: upto 7 LPA (25% of base salary)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 4334400 LPA for the first year
Benefits: Standard Walmart Benefits (Relocation, health, etc)
Other details: I have 2 more offers but they are lesser than this offer.
I know this is a good offer as compared to my current salary, but this offer is not at par with the market. This is a non-negotiated salary.

My interviews went well. I have initiated the negotiation over email. Still, any tips/advices would be helpful.

Negotiation Update: 60 days of my notice period are still left (as of 14th July'22). HR said that at this point of time, she doesn't have any solid reason to negotiate and take approvals. If I can convince my current LM to leave me early, she can take it further right now. Second option is that I have to accept the offer letter now and we can revisit the negotiations once my joining date is close (i.e. in August).
I don't have anything in writing, so my plan is to accept the offer letter on the portal and keep giving interviews. If I land a better offer, I will negotiate/reject accordingly and/or will renegotiate in Aug.
I think my HR is helpful (as per all the communications I have had with her) and we can close this in August.

Thanks to all the community members for sharing their advices/experiences. :)

title: Microsoft | SDE (L59) | New Grad | Hyderabad
content:
* **Education:** B.tech in CSE
* **Years of Experience:** 0
* **Date of the Offer:** June 2022
* **Company:** Microsoft
* **Title/Level:** SDE (L59)
* **Location:** Hyderabad (Hybrid)
* **Salary:** INR 15,00,000 per year
	* **Basic Pay:** INR 7,08,000 per year
	* **Allowances:** INR 7,92,000 per year (Employer PF, HRA, LTA, Special Allowance)
* **Relocation:** INR 3,59,000 (INR 3,00,000 LumpSum + INR 59,000 Allowance)
* **Retention Bonus:** INR 5,00,000 (INR 2,50,000 for 1st year + INR 2,50,000 for 2nd year)
* **Performance Bonus:** 0 - 20% (usually 10% ~ INR 1,50,000)
* **Stocks/ RSUs:** $35,000 ~ INR 27,00,000 (25%/ year vesting cycle)
* **Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):** ~ INR 26,00,000
* **Benefits:** 
	* **Sick/ Casual Leaves:** 32 (12 Sick + 20 Casual) paid leaves per year
	* **Other Leaves:** Public Holiday, Maternity, Adoption/Surrogacy, Paternity, Bereavement and Caregiver Leaves
	* **Medical Insurance:** upto INR 5,00,000 cover (with option to include parents)
	* **Personal Accident and Life Insurance:** upto INR 45,00,000 cover (3X of Base Salary)
	* **Tuition Assistance:** upto INR 2,00,000 cover for tuition fees for higher studies
	* **Childcare:** INR 5,000 per month per child (3 months to 8 years old)
	* **India Perks+:** upto INR 30,000 per year (reimbursable for physical, mental and emotional, and financial wellbeing)
	* **Gratuity:** INR 34,000 per year (capped at total of INR 20,00,000)
	* **Hybrid Work:** Can be availed immediately on or after joining (with discussion and permission from reporting manager)
	* **Other:** Employee Assistance Program, World Wide Emergency Policy, Car and Accommodation Lease Policy
* **Other details:** On-campus (Pool Drive) Opportunity
* **Interim Offer:** [here](https://leetcode.com/discuss/compensation/2079959/microsoft-sde-new-grad/1408602)
